H0.text: Mutation is the mechanism responsible for the change in allele distribution when a large plant population imposes selective pressure on a smaller, isolated group of plants.

H1.text: Hybridization is the mechanism responsible for the change in allele distribution that results when a large plant population imposes selective pressure on a smaller, isolated group of plants.

H2.text: Genetic drift is the mechanism responsible for the change in allele distribution when a large plant population imposes selective pressure on a smaller, isolated group of plants.

H3.text: Trait acquisition is the mechanism responsible for the change in allele distribution that occurs when a large plant population imposes selective pressure on a smaller, isolated group of plants.

A4.text: Genetic drift is the change in the frequency of an existing gene variant (allele) in a population due to random chance.

A5.text: In small populations, fixation can occur in just a few generations.
